reviews.text:
On a sweltering hot Wednesday afternoon in September my twin brother Stephen and I headed in the magnificent Gothic Quarter ( Barri Gótic  ) hitting some of the great taverns to be found in the many plaza's in this most beautiful of cities ,we headed into Placa Del Rei ( Kings Square  ) were we marvelled at the amazing an ancient architecture this plaza holds and the stand out feature in my opinion is the magnificent Mirador Del Rei Marti ( King Martin's Watchtower ) .
Built in 1302 ,at one time this was considered  one of the tallest building in the known world ,it's a truelly amazing and evocative looking tower,part of the Reial Major Palace complex ( Palau Reial Major ) it blends in seamlessly with the amazing architecture of the wonderful Gothic Quarter. 
If you enjoy your photography don't forget the snapper as you will take some great photos. 
Easy to locate on Placa Del Rei in an area teeming with pubs, bars and restaurants and some amazing architecture and a major tourist destination. 
Well worth seeking out.
